result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alyssa A. Puphal

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on April 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on March 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:56 AM . Defendant Alyssa A. Puphal in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied.  Attorney Hannah E Kottke in court for Alyssa A. Puphal. Attorney Kottke requesting to adjourn plea and sentencing. Attorney Tlusty makes argument. Jury trial scheduled for April 5th and 6th, final pretrial scheduled for March 6, 2023, Status hearing or plea and sentencing scheduled for November 30, 2022. First jury trial will be 21CM21, the rest of the cases are stacked behind the CM case-JN

Prior: 300 Fischer St., Lot 6, Unity, WI 54488 United States

11:44 AM Defendant Alyssa A. Puphal in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hannah E Kottke in court for Alyssa A. Puphal. Attorney Kottle is requesting that he plea and sentencing be rescheduled for another date and time.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Notice was personally given to defendant in 21CF50 that included all of the cases.  No notice printed for each case.

04:03 PM Defendant Alyssa A. Puphal in court with attorney Hannah E Kottke.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification has been complied.  Attorney Tlusty indicated that they are close to resolution.  Attorney Kottke agrees that they are close to resolution.  Plea and sentencing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.  - rt

Status hearing on May 31, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

02:38 PM Defendant Alyssa A. Puphal in court with attorney Hannah E Kottke.  Defendant Alyssa A. Puphal in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   Bond continued.  Plea of not guilty entered in the tracking citations.  Pretrial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 9:00 am.  Status hearing or plea sentencing for May 31, 2022 at 4:00 pm.  - rt
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconisn without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall have no contact with T.D.P. - dob: 04-28-1996.
Initial Appearance set March 15, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.

11:50 am - Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alyssa Puphal appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header except for the bail jumping.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting the court take judicial notice of cases that defendant is currently on bond and find probable cause for the bail jumping.  Court finds probable cause for bail jumping.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license; no contact with T.D.P. - dob:  4-28-1996.  Statement by defendant. Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court orders the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 21CF50, 21CF52, 21CF63, 21CF65, 21CF72, 21CF78 and 21CM21.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
